description: The main character is Kou Kitamura, son of the owner of Kitamura Sports. In the same neighborhood is a batting center run by the Tsukishima family. Due to their proximity and the relationship between their businesses, the Kitamura and Tsukishima familes have been close for many years, with their children going back and forth between the two homes like extended family. Because Kou and Wakaba were the same age and always together, Aoba was jealous of all the time Kou spent with her older sister. Aoba is a natural pitcher with excellent form, and Kou secretly trains to become as good as she was, even while publicly showing little interest in baseball.

node.description: He debuted with Kieta Bakoun (1970), won the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1983 and 2009. He was once an assistant of [Isami Ishii](https://anilist.co/staff/194198).

**Birth Name:** Ayaka Iida (飯田絢香)  
**Height:** 157 cm (5' 2") 

[Website](http://room-ayaka.jp/) | [Twitter (Staff)](https://twitter.com/ayakastaff) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayaka_1218/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayaka_official_jp/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/AyakaAstAtion)

Ayaka Iida, known simply by the mononym Ayaka, is a female Japanese singer, songwriter and record producer formerly signed to Warner Music Japan. Born in Osaka, she moved to Tokyo to pursue a singing career.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~

__[Website](https://kobukuro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TeamKobukuro) | [Instagram (run by Shunsuke)](https://www.instagram.com/kobukuro_kuroda_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/kobukuroofficialTV)__

__Formed:__ 1998

__Introduction:__
Kobukuro is a Japanese musical duo under record label Warner Music Japan (2001–), having previously been under MINOSUKE RECORDS (1999–2000), who have been active between September 1998 and August 2011, with a break between August 2011 and March 2012, resuming band activities from April 2012.

The name of the unit stems from the first four letters from each of the members' family name, where Kobu comes from __Kobu__chi, while Kuro comes from __Kuro__da.

__Members:__
- [Shunsuke Kuroda](https://anilist.co/staff/173356/Shunsuke-Kuroda) (黒田俊介, くろだしゅんすけ) – vocalist, sometimes in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Kentarou Kobuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/173355/Kentarou-Kobuchi) (小渕健太郎, こぶちけんたろう) – guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
He is an animator, character designer and animation director. He was formerly affiliated with Tama Production.
